educations.schoolName: Virginia Consortium Program in Clinical Psychology: Offered Jointly By WM, EVMS, ODU, and NSU

defaultPosition.description: Assessment, triage, and mental health treatment for undocumented male and female detainees. Services are provided within an integrated clinic providing medical, dental, vision, psychiatric and psychological care. Acting MH liaison between ICE Health Service Corps (IHSC), ICE Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO), and detention center staff. Specialty training in multicultural issues and use of medical translation services.
defaultPosition.title: Clinical Psychologist

positions.description: Assessment, triage, and mental health treatment for undocumented male and female detainees. Services are provided within an integrated clinic providing medical, dental, vision, psychiatric and psychological care. Acting MH liaison between ICE Health Service Corps (IHSC), ICE Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO), and detention center staff. Specialty training in multicultural issues and use of medical translation services.
positions.title: Clinical Psychologist

positions.description: Description: 2000 hour Clinical Psychology postdoctoral fellowship. Worked within a traditional Health Outpatient Clinic (30 hours per week) as well as a primary care setting (10 hours per week). Operated as a member of an interdisciplinary team of psychologists, psychiatrists, and nurse practitioners. Served as a front-line clinician for a rural and under-served population of adolescents to adults with a range of mental health concerns. Duties included assessment and diagnosis, consultation, crisis intervention, individual therapy (brief and longer term), couples therapy, and adult ADHD and bariatric evaluations. Two hours of supervision with licensed psychologists per week. Carried a case load of 30-35 patients per week. Additionally, received specialty couples therapy training from Douglas K.Snyder, Ph.D., psychologist and specialist in marital therapy.
positions.title: Psychology Postdoctoral Fellow

positions.description: Assist with the Healthy School Food Collaborative study. Team lead collecting behavioral and consumption data of school children within the New Orleans School System. Data will be used to create healthier lunch options for New Orleans elementary students.
positions.title: Team Lead Researcher

positions.description:
APA Accredited, Pre-doctoral internship
                                       
Description: 2000 hour Clinical Psychology internship focusing on the psychological treatment and assessment of veterans within the GCVHC System. Specialized training in PTSD and comorbid substance abuse, Military Sexual Trauma, outpatient mental health, behavioral medicine, capacity evaluations, FEMA disaster intervention, Employee Assistance, and geriatric mental health care 

Assessment experience: RBANS, PAI, MMPI-2, Rorschach, SLUMS, TSI
Director of Clinical Training: Shannon Fussell, Ph.D.
	
Awarded the Erwin L. Shatus Outstanding Psychology Intern Award upon completion of internship
positions.title: Psychology Intern

positions.description:
Provided individual and group treatment for children & adolescents referred to Renaissance Academy for behavioral or emotional difficulties. 
	
Tests administered: WISC-IV, MACI, BASC-2, Rorschach
positions.title: Psychology Extern (unpaid)

positions.description:
Worked within the VA's Military Sexual Trauma program. Responsible for the assessment and treatment of veterans with MST-related PTSD and full range of Axis I and Axis II disorders. Co-leader for Seeking Safety group. Trained in Cognitive Processing Therapy and DBT.

Tests administered: MMPI-II, MCMI-III, Rorschach
positions.title: Psychology Extern (unpaid)

positions.description:
Within the PTSD Clinical Team (PCT) clinic, provided assessment and individual treatment of veterans with combat related PTSD and full range of Axis I and Axis II disorders. 

Tests administered: MMPI-II, MCMI-III, Rorschach, Clinically Administered PTSD Survey (CAPS), PCL-S, MMSE
positions.title: Psychology Extern (unpaid)

positions.description:
Conducted assessments of children and adolescents ages 6-12 for learning disabilities, ADHD, PDD, PTSD, conduct disorders, and other issues.

Tests administered: WISC-IV, Incomplete Sentence Test, The Roberts Apperception Test for Children-2, WJ-III NU, C-TONI 2, BASC-2, Conners ADHD Index, Classroom observation
positions.title: Psychology Extern (unpaid)

positions.description: Involved in the assessment and treatment of seriously mentally ill inpatient and NGRI women. Provided input to the IDT regarding competency and treatment issues. Tests administered: MMSE, Clinical interview
positions.title: Psychology Extern (unpaid)

positions.description: Lead interviewer for ASU study assessing physical and mental health issues among Mexican American families. Was responsible for a team of interviewers while in participant's home.
positions.title: Lead Interviewer
